No, I didn't change H1/H2 sizes or add uppercase. Current state:

- No `text-transform: uppercase` on general H1/H2. The only uppercase rules are:
  - `.logo-text` (line 207) — logo only
  - `.hero-placeholder h1` (line 541) — hero placeholder only

- H1/H2 font sizes:
  - `.article-header h1`: 42px
  - `.article-content h2`: 32px
  - `.recent-posts h2`: 32px
  - `.list-header h1`: 42px

- General heading rule (lines 26-37): only sets `font-family` and `font-weight`; no `font-size` or `text-transform`.

If you're seeing uppercase on H1/H2 elsewhere, it may be from content or another stylesheet. Should I add explicit rules to prevent uppercase on general H1/H2 elements?
